span.strong: Check out this video we made for you.

strong.span: Please see our Franklin School Facebook page
for an informational video from Mrs. Shelton.
The Office hours will be sporadic during this school closure.
Please call 530-822-5151 before you stop by
to make sure it is open during that time.

div.span: I hope this letter finds you and your family safe and well. This is certainly an unprecedented time! I am still working from my office, and I can’t tell how strange it is to have the campus so quiet. I truly miss the sounds of a busy school campus. Most of all I miss the children’s laughter, voices, and presence!

The May 4 date is rapidly approaching. As much as I would like to open the school campus, it does not look like it can happen at this time. The “Shelter in Place” orders are still in place for our community, so I need to adhere to these guidelines and ensure that students and staff remain safe and healthy. At this time, school will be closed until further notice. If in the event we are able to safely open (even if it is for a few days) I will let you know immediately.

In the month ahead teachers will continue to provide learning opportunities for students. It looks a bit different at each grade level, but we are doing are best to continue to connect students with staff. Thank you to all of you for making this work during this very difficult time. If there is anything you need, please don’t hesitate to contact your child’s teacher. I can be reached at (530)822-5151 x202.

Mr. Dahl and I are working on some activities for the summer months. It is our hope that we can bring the school together this summer for a spaghetti dinner, or a field day. Mr. Dahl is also working on some special activities for our 8th grade students. I truly hope that this can happen. It would be great to bring all of us together this summer to spend some special (and much needed) time together!
Although school is not reopening, learning and connections will still go on for the remainder of the school year. Stay safe, be kind and take care of one another!

em.em: Making a difference for all students.

em.span: Our vision is to prepare all students for the future demands of career, college and life in the 21st century. We will provide an exceptional educational experience in a caring, engaging, safe and healthy environment in partnership with family and community. Students will be technologically competent and will develop creative, collaborative, and critical problem-solving skills to consistently meet standards of excellence.

div.strong:
Franklin Elementary is a
California Distinguished School
